intro: Rapanea densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dense foliage and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. The leaves are革质 (leathery) and dark green, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
